title: Evidence Gatherers against tree campaigners. Who is paying and how much so far?

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Having recently attended various legal peaceful protests against street tree felling in Sheffield I have been shocked and dismayed along with many others to see so called Evidence Gatherers present. Contrary to Cllr Lodge's assurances that peaceful protesters outside barriers would not be photographed or filmed this has not been the case.  On Vernon road on Monday, 4 evidence gatherers were present for much of the day and although there was no evidence of filming they were marching up and own the road at regular intervals in a menacing manner scrutinising both people and buildings even though no felling was attempted and so no barriers erected. I would like to ask the following;
Who has sanctioned the evidence gathering against peaceful protesters?
Has Cllr Lodge gone back on his word re documenting evidence about innocent people going about their business who happen to be in and around areas not closed off for felling?
What are the legal ramifications for SCC re unwarranted surveillance of the citizens of Sheffield?
Do SCC acknowledge the right of citizens to walk the streets of Sheffield without being intimidated, harassed and followed?
Would one be right in thinking that it is the council tax payers of Sheffield who are footing the bill for these services?
How much so far has been spent on employing such evidence gatherers to date?
Thank you for your time in anticipation of your consideration of these matters.
Yours faithfully,
Anne Barr

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI /1076
Dear Anne Barr,
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Evidence
Gatherers Against Tree Campaigners which we received on 18/10/17.
Please find below, Sheffield City Council’s response to your request:
The Council’s approach to the filming of protestors remains as set out on
the Council’s website
[1]
http://www.sheffield.gov.uk/content/shef...
.
Although a number of your questions are not requests for recorded
information we believe that this site will provide further context in
regard to the Council’s filming of protestors.
Up to 9^th October the cost of the collecting evidence was met by
Sheffield City Council. As from this date the costs will be met by Amey.
The Council’s costs are not yet finalised; once payments are made they
will be available through the Council’s publication at
[2]
http://data.sheffield.gov.uk
of spend information over £250.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.

request, you are entitled to have this reviewed.  You can ask for an

[3][Sheffield City Council request email].
